title: How to Keep Necklaces and Chains from Rusting

steps.title: Put on lotion before you wear your chain.
steps.content: Put on lotion before you wear your chain. Lotion, creams, and perfumes can all cause your chain to rust. Make sure that they are completely rubbed in and dry before you put on your necklace or chain. [1] X Trustworthy Source Gemological Institute of America Nonprofit institute responsible for gemological research and education and setting gemstone buying and selling standards Go to source

steps.title: Put necklaces away before you shower.
steps.content: Put necklaces away before you shower. Any water can cause your necklace or chain to rust. Before you take a shower, remove your necklace. Put it safely away somewhere outside of the bathroom. If you set it down on the counter, it may still get wet and rust. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove jewelry before swimming.
steps.content: Remove jewelry before swimming. If you are planning on going to the pool or beach, leave your necklaces and chains at home. The water will cause the metal to rust. [3] X Trustworthy Source Gemological Institute of America Nonprofit institute responsible for gemological research and education and setting gemstone buying and selling standards Go to source You can wear necklaces that contain no metal, such as ones made with a leather cord or braided string.

steps.title: Apply a sealant to your necklaces and chains.
steps.content: Apply a sealant to your necklaces and chains. By sealing your jewelry, you can prevent rust from developing on it. Look for a sealant that is designed for the type of metal that you want to protect. Spray or brush it over the chain, and let it dry completely. Do not use nail polish, as nail polish will flake off in a few days. Sealant can be purchased at craft or hardware stores.

steps.title: Wear other types of jewelry on rainy days.
steps.content: Wear other types of jewelry on rainy days. If you think it is going to rain, avoid wearing metal jewelry that day. Instead, choose a necklace made out of fabric, plastic, or another non-metal material.

steps.title: Store jewelry in closed containers.
steps.content: Store jewelry in closed containers. Use jewelry boxes, cases, and sleeves to store your necklaces and chains. This will protect them from humid and open air while you are not wearing them. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Place each necklace or chain in a separate zipper bag.
steps.content: Place each necklace or chain in a separate zipper bag. The bag will keep air and humidity out. Make sure that every piece has their own bag. You can then place these bags in your jewelry box. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Place silica gel bags in your jewelry box.
steps.content: Place silica gel bags in your jewelry box. You can purchase small bags of silica gel balls. Place one packet in your jewelry box near your necklaces or chains. You can even put one small packet inside of a zipper bag with your chain. This will keep any additional moisture out. These can be bought at hardware stores or online. They are sometimes included in the box when you purchase jewelry or other items.

steps.title: Place the chain in jewelry cleaning solution.
steps.content: Place the chain in jewelry cleaning solution. There are many jewelry cleaning solutions on the market. These come as foams, liquids, and pastes. Find one that is labeled as suitable for the type of metal you are cleaning. Make sure that you always follow the directions on the package. If you have a container filled with liquid, you simply need to drop your chain inside. Let it soak for the recommended amount of time. Foam solutions can be sprayed onto your chain. You will then scrub the chain with a toothbrush and rinse it. Make sure you dry it completely after rinsing. Pastes may be applied to the chain with a cloth and rinsed off.

steps.title: Soak the chain in a baking soda bath.
steps.content: Soak the chain in a baking soda bath. Fill a bowl with boiling water. Stir in one tablespoon of salt and one tablespoon of baking soda. Soak the chain or necklace for up to five minutes. Once it is done, dry it with a microfiber cloth. Make sure the necklace is completely dry before you put it away. [6] X Research source Do not use this method if you have gemstones on your necklace. If you are worried about damaging your necklace or chain, you can test a small part of it first. Dip one end of the necklace in the solution to see how it reacts. Do not use paper towels, as they can scratch the metal.

steps.title: Take valuable necklaces or gemstones to the jewelers.
steps.content: Take valuable necklaces or gemstones to the jewelers. A jeweler can professionally clean your jewelry without damaging it. This is recommended for any jewelry made out of more precious metals, such as gold, or for jewelry that contains gemstones. Get it cleaned every six to twelve months to prevent it from tarnishing.
